website_summaries.verdict: The Adistar Boost ESM from Adidas is a running companion that testers generally enjoyed. The high quality materials that were used for the shoe work well. It’s a shoe that offers mild support in the mid-foot while being a reliable gear for neutral runners.
pros: The flexible upper unit provide seamless support for the comfort of the runner
Runners were satisfied with the shoe's external heel counter that improves fit on the rear area
The color options for the Boost ESM were appreciated by those who want more aesthetic choices
The boost™ mid-sole technology offers energy returns while also making sure that the foot is well-supported
A significant number of runners applauded the cushioning system of the shoe that delivers a smooth and responsive ride
Reviewers noted the efficacy of the outsole rubber in terms of traction
cons: The Adistar Boost ESM is an expensive running shoe
There were complaints that the mid-sole was a bit stiff and unresponsive
Most were worried that the outsole was too thin to be as efficient on a long-term basis

customer_reviews.title: The real color is not orange
customer_reviews.text: The picture of the product is not accurate, the real color is not orange at all, instead it is pink / salmon, besides that issue the rest of the shoe is fine; I think the seller used a retouched picture of the product to make it more buyable, because when you see the real color (pink / salmon), it makes you think twice before buying it, I won't return them because I need them, in the end I am happy to have the shoes, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Miguel Franco

customer_reviews.title: I am just starting to run. Being flat footed ...
customer_reviews.text: I am just starting to run. Being flat footed I had a difficult time finding a decent shoe at a decent price. This shoe so far has run with me hundreds of miles. Never once have I had any noticeable problems due to the shoe. Yes the color is not as shown, it looks orange in the images, but its really a salmon colored pink. I did not buy the shoe for how it looks, rather the performance. I would definitely buy another pair after I retire these. Update, I've worn out my original pair, just placed another replacement. Can't wait for them to arrive, ordered them in red/black this time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Arakaki

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes. Very comfy and provide good support. Sorry I'm not a professional or heavy runner so I cant speak super technical about the product. My old worn shows were giving me knee pain on my 3 mile jogs and with these it went away. Most likely due to my old ones needing to be replaced. They do run a bit small though. If your borderline on a shoe size or in between, order a half size bigger. Mine worked out as I was able to strech them a bit by putting my cedar shoe trees in them for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Desai

customer_reviews.title: Shoe runs small. Normally an 8-8.5 needed to get a 9.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe runs a little small. The toes really cramp together in the front. Overall very comfortable on the arch support and feels like a decent running shoe. Concerned about the quality of the sole. The Sole is very thin and can wear down. Wouldn't consider these for the average runner.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe especially for the money! This is an older model but a goodie. Very decent motion control, boost is reactive and cushy. The only downside is these run slightly small - 1/2 size IMO, and these are not a high mileage shoe. Paid full price when these came out, and was delighted to see these are over $100 less now! Killer deal for this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: SnackAttack

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are great. But as is always the case with Adidas ...
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are great. But as is always the case with Adidas footwear, the shoes are cut a bit narrow and a big smaller than most. A Nike or a New Balance fits my foot at 12. Adidas sometimes requires .5 or 1 size higher than my actual size. People with 2E or wider feet, skip Adidas products entirely, you will not get them to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, runs small, short life
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 10.5, 11 is what I get with Adidas. But I love these shoes, this is my third pair. They are the only shoes I have found that don’t give me shin splints. However, that’s how I know they are worn out, because I do start getting shin splints with them after 200-300 miles. Not a great life for a running shoe, but I keep getting them.
customer_reviews.author: PM1620

customer_reviews.title: Runs small for Adidas
customer_reviews.text: Nicely cushioned and supportive but feels small for the size. I usually just buy the same size Adidas because the size seems consistent as the style changes or are discontinued. This time it didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: I'll take mine on Ice

customer_reviews.title: Run very small, not great for running
customer_reviews.text: Have worn many Adidas running shoes but these just did not fit or feel right. Use them for casual wear which is fine, but they are at least 1 full size small. I normally wear an 11.5 and ordered a 12 based on reviews. My toes still hit the front of the toe box and never felt comfortable on any type of workout.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wenning

customer_reviews.title: Go-to shoe
customer_reviews.text: Hate this has been discontinued. I'm flat footed with mild overpronation. this has been by far the most comfortable shoe. I have ran 5k's to marathons in these shoes. I have bought up multiple pairs, I'll be sad when they are all gone :(
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Boost
customer_reviews.text: Once again Adidas hit it out of the park with these. I've been wearing Boost for the past couple of years because of comfort. I was having problems with pain after working on my feet all day but Boost has cured me. Great shoe again from Adidas.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight with stabilizing
customer_reviews.text: I like the boost by adidas. Also there is cushion for stability on the inside of the foot. Boost is superior cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Jensen Parr

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, and comfortable. But the durability....
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and breathe well. I have used them for almost everyday wear and in just a little over a year the soles are falling apart and worn away. Not as durable as other adidas I own. I had hoped they would finally be the replacement for the discontinued salvation line, but I will have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Perkinke

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 8.5D shoe and run in 9.0 shoes. I ordered a 9 and it fits great same as my new balance 980 size 9.
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: Energy Boost is the Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: These are really comfy running shoes. I love the boost foam a lot. I kept these for running around the house and for errands as opposed to strictly running. The only thing I don't like about it is that the red easily stains, so now I have a bunch of stains above my right foot. Besides that, and it is purely cosmetic, these just fit like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: HokiEE01

customer_reviews.title: including several Adidas that I loved. For whatever reason
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid runner and have worn a variety of shoes, including several Adidas that I loved. For whatever reason, however, these shoes left me with intense heel pain.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for training
customer_reviews.text: Very well made shoe for runners. Good support, very good cushioning with the 'Boost' sole.
customer_reviews.author: ST1

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: I love Adidas this product fits well very comfortable but curl up at the tail
customer_reviews.author: M0054171705120 Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, great feeling
customer_reviews.text: This pair of shoes changed my mind about Adidas. The new sole and support is fantastic. Light weight. They aren't red, more salmon, but still sharp looking. Haven't seen the next generation, but look forward to purchasing them.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: 🖒 RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, light weight, fits perfectly, super service, clean packaging.
customer_reviews.author: fadi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! I'm very happy with these and would ...
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! I'm very happy with these and would buy them again in an instant! The boost feels very bouncy when walking (less so when running), and the upper is very light-weight and breathable. The only thing not stellar about these shoes is the insole.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My all-time favorite running shoe, hands down. The shoes run a little small, so I typically go up 0.5(US). Toe box is a bit narrow, but you can accommodate for that by adjusting the lacing.
customer_reviews.author: Disco-Stu

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feet
customer_reviews.text: This shoes has the curved toe going on the inside, so all your toes get blisters like under armour running shoes. Little to rigid, no cushion on the toe area and foot pad. My heel hurt after the 4 mile run. Top of right foot began hurting after mile 3. I own a lot of running shoes, and this one did not make the cut. Staying with Nike.
customer_reviews.author: Micki

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers have stated
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have stated, the Adistar Boost run a little small. I wear an 11 in NMD and UltraBoost, but ordered an 11.5 in the Adistar. Many reviewers have commented on the tight toe box in this shoe, this is because Adidas chose to put a thicker insole in the Adistar. I'm not sure why Adidas went with a thicker insole in the forefoot when you have the most comfortable cushioning with boost? Overall a very comfortable, stable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them, fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love them, fit well, excellent support and look great. 2nd pair. True fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: love them and all of the other high quality Adidas ...
customer_reviews.text: The look and the feel. I usually get trail running shoes, but the reviews and the upcoming winter, well tread mill here I come. I have worn Adidas for the last tem years. Raven Boost, love them and all of the other high quality Adidas shoes. Cant waint to see how my feet and knee feel after a good 5-10 K.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Woodhead

customer_reviews.title: Go HARD IN THE PAINT when you run with these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a must buy for anyone looking to run alot or generally expect to be on there feet for more than 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Bunshigi Hanumie

customer_reviews.title: tennis shoes size is incorrect
customer_reviews.text: normally mi size is 9.5, actually I bought a pair of Skechers boots that size and fitted perfectly. this adidas was too small either wrong label or defective. I have returned the product and will prate the company when it's all completed and I get my money back thank you. esteban
customer_reviews.author: Esteban López Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Dope@
customer_reviews.text: I am a 10.5, bought 11 and it's perfect. Love them. I think i am gonna buy another pair, or maybe 2!
customer_reviews.author: Samy

customer_reviews.title: Color is more of pink than orange
customer_reviews.text: Product is good but the color is more on the pink side.
customer_reviews.author: alex cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Way TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Definitely go at least a 1/2 size up if not more. I am returning as almost immediately the shoes damaged the second toe on both of my feet because they are too small and I went a 1/2 size up.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: These shoes made me an addidas boost fan!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. The bottoms have awesome gripping ability because of the quality continental material. I've got great support for my overpronation and plenty of room for my toes while still having a supported heel.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Wear on a track and cross country running.
customer_reviews.author: A. McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and feeling running shoe. Solid support. Runs about 1/4 size small.
customer_reviews.author: lzalulu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoes. Order a half size larger than normal.
customer_reviews.author: JZA22

customer_reviews.title: Great Shpe
customer_reviews.text: Very lite, very soft on foot strike but stability is lacking. Over all I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pick your size carefully
customer_reviews.text: about half an inch smaller than Asics of the same size and style (running shoes)
customer_reviews.author: gencumd

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes you can get
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable best running shoes I have ever owned they are my second pair I would not buy anything other than these
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and stability
customer_reviews.text: I’m 9.5 but I order 10, that works well for me. This shoe is size 10 but feels like 9.
customer_reviews.author: White goat

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are salmon pink NOT red
customer_reviews.text: The "red" accents on these shoes are salmon pink, NOT red. These aren't even close to red. I'm afraid this is too much for me to stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great stability running shoe. Was a fan of Saucony but there are just as good. Lighter but with a little less support.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Good and affordable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe for runners who are not featherlight. Good cushioning, lightweight and very comfortable fit - providing support though. I had basics, saucy and NB before - this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus Nebe

customer_reviews.title: this is a good shoe for something with a bit firmer sole
customer_reviews.text: I'm 215lbs... this is a good shoe for something with a bit firmer sole.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Adidas shoes work best for me. As usual, this pair is not only comfortable but urges you to run.
customer_reviews.author: Beaver

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and light. Good energy return. So far, so good! Great price for the quality of the sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: I have wide feet and the shoe doesn't seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and the shoe doesn't seem to have a lot of width. I would maybe go up a full size for toe space and this may help with width too..
customer_reviews.author: Dave Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good service, easy returns
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, got them quick and easy. I did return the shoes previously, they run small but other than that everything has been awesome
customer_reviews.author: Joe Zarate

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes for the money. Wish they had a little more heel support.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Mattioni

customer_reviews.title: But very comfortable shoe and great for running
customer_reviews.text: Red color is more of a salmon/pink. But very comfortable shoe and great for running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, I ended up buying another pair. I'm an RN and on my feet all day and moving, couldn't had asked for better shoes. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They fit like a glove and provide great support.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Keith Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I have ever worn they are awesome
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 1/2 size up and still small. Great so far really comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Thingsbetter

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoes I'm very satisfied with their performance and style. I recommend these shoes to everyone who needs quality at a good price
customer_reviews.author: john rice

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fit as expected. I will use to run my first marathon
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed because the shoes look like a imitation with poor termination and I spec the original.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A ACEVEDO

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but its pink.
customer_reviews.text: My last pair were the energy boost 2's which I absolutely love! Tried to save some money and trade down a model to these. they are very nice. They are PINK! not red but salmon as my daughter tried to put politely. Like I said, they are nice fitting, not as good as the energy boost model in terms of arch support.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: It has voodoo magic that doesn't let you run slow!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Pros: - It's a light shoe. - It has voodoo magic sole technology that makes you run fast. :D - It has some cushion. - Laces are great. - It's a fast shoe. - Fit as expected. Cons: - It doesn't let you run slow. I feel guilty walking in them. - Toe box is narrow. My big toes' nail are turning black. :( - Though cushy at first, I started feeling the pavement just after a few weeks of running in them. - I don't think this shoe is made for everyday pavement and asphalt running.
customer_reviews.author: InternetForumReviewName

customer_reviews.title: Shoes were used and worn. Would return them but ...
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were used and worn. Would return them but I need them now. Wish there was a discounted price based on them being worn. Also the accent color is pink/salmon color not red.
customer_reviews.author: ross

customer_reviews.title: This shoes are really good, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This shoes are really good, comfortable, it looks really pretty. it is a shame the size, regularly in Adidas I am 11.5, but this ones aren't fit really well, There are a difference between adidas made in china and vietnam, I think, All my shoes are 11.5 and fit really well.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: If you want top cushioning and support, keep looking...
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews that indicated this shoe would be the best for me in terms of cushioning and support. Not true. It's ok and I like Adidas shoes but it is somewhat lightweight and doesn't feel like a well cushioned shoe. Also, the fit was not what I expected based on Adidas shoes I had previously owned - it was probably a half-size too small.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not as comforatable as you would think
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as I thought it would be. I have the Adistar Raven boost, Supernova boost which are super comfortable but loses side support because of the boost sole. So I thought this Adistar boost ESM would be the best of both world, with the new Boost technology and the old supernova tech. Well it was a good idea but does not work. the arch becomes really hard, the front of the sole is very thin and hard. you don't feel the boost anymore.
customer_reviews.author: ckthe1

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit me very well. Make me feel light footed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great long distance trainers
customer_reviews.text: I Run marathons and shorter distance I have always used Mizuno or Brooks. This shoes are great! Good cushioning and perfect fit. This summer I run in 82 to 88f weather and my feet were super confy! Will alternate with Enigma 6! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo Di Martino

customer_reviews.title: much like a majority of box store shoes
customer_reviews.text: Just don't look at any shoe that isn't $100+ . I typically buy Sunpernova Gtx but I bout these cause they looked similar and seemed to be constructed in a similar fashion. NOPE. These are junk, much like a majority of box store shoes. If you seek quality and comfort, move along
customer_reviews.author: Down River Bound

customer_reviews.title: 5'7" 210lbs runner
customer_reviews.text: my absolute go to pair of running shoes. I was insecure about the salmon pink look but honestly it's grown on me. The fit is perfect as expected. The comfort is a 12/10. Plenty of cushion and stability. I'm 100% satisfied. And can't forget to mention, I have medium-wide feet, and flat footed. lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for running.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these just over a year ago and rarely wear them. I first tried them on pavement but I got really bad shin splints. I thought that it might have been cause I did too much too soon, but when I tried them out a second time I got the same result. I stopped using them a couple weeks and then tried again on a treadmill and even though I didnt get shin splints, my feet ached. I did like how light they were, but they dont have much cushion. I now use them strictly for walking long distances like a trip to the zoo or safari park. I would not recommend these and I'm upset I wasted $80.
customer_reviews.author: neneloco

customer_reviews.title: I wear size 12 and 1/2 and thought size 13 ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 12 and 1/2 and thought size 13 would fit. It is still too short unless I go soulless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved these sneakers so I just bought him a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: FT

product_meta.title: adidas Men's Energy Boost T-Shirt
product_meta.description: Men's sports shirt with short sleeves, made by adidas. model has a high light material that is breathable maximum. missing feature climalite that wicks sweat away from the body.
